reviews.text: Staying in Oyado Yoshinoya has been a beautiful experience.
reviews.title: Everything about this ryokan is beautiful.
A delight to stay at Oyado Yoshinoya
reviews.text: We were warmly welcomed by the family who own and run this ryokan, and although they speak really very little english, we felt so warmly welcomed and felt like we were coming "home". What a lovely way to feel about a place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was immaculate, with tatami mats and futons which were really comfortable. There were spare blankets and pillows in the room, but we were very warm. We were given towels and a kimono, and the owner came up to our room and showed us through the times for the onsen, breakfast, dinner times etc. We were also given an english walking map of Takayama which was very useful.
reviews.title: very good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was made up daily, we could have hot green tea in our room, a little treat was left for us each morning, and it just felt really beautiful.
reviews.title: Cozy minkushu with private onsen

reviews.text: We loved our two night stay at Oyado Yoshinoya. Our hosts were really lovely and made us feel very welcome, and the ryokan itself is great.
reviews.title: Delight in Takayama

reviews.text: Our room was large, comfortable with lovely decorations, with very comfy futons. It was also a treat to use the hot spring.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Meals are optional extras and the food was great - we had delicious hoba miso with hida beef and lots of other delights.
reviews.title: Perfect local guest house

reviews.text: The location is also excellent - although about a 10-15 minute walk from the station, it is very close to the Sanmachi district of Takayama.
reviews.title: 2nd visit to Oyado Yoshinoya and we still love it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Oyado Yoshinoya as they have a good review on Trip Adviser. The owners of Yoshinoya were very kind and helpful. We have ordered non Japanese breakfast as my husband & kids were getting tired of eating rice in the morning. They were happily our request. The room was huge, but I guess e are lucky that we are the only guest. If it was high season, I don't think we could have a such a big room. The location was excellent. It located in the center of Takayama city in front of Betsuin so majority of sight seeing place are in the walking distance. But several things they can improve.
reviews.title: A real Japanese experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took two rooms for a two nights stay. My room smelt a bit musty but we got used to it. It faced the main road but we didn't have any issue with noise. Our request for lower floor rooms were met and we were put on the second floor. The minshuku was cosy and really felt like we were staying in our own house. Despite obviously being an old house, the toilets were nice and felt new. Being a 7 roomed lodging Oyado Yoshinoya had ample supply of toilets and bathrooms. Two female toilets on our floor and seperate male one. Two baths on the first floor plus I think, more toilets. Sinks on each floor. Downstairs equipt with 3 hair dryers. The bathroom were common baths but lockable. One for two and the other one slightly larger, for four bathers. Not sure what is on the top floor. The onsens were of a good size. Long enough for us to spread out.
reviews.title: Really Nice Minshuku

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Japanese style room was of a good size. Even with the futons laid out there was still space for the coffee table and two cushions. Excellent futons, really comfy and fluffy. There was also a common room with a laptop with internet access which doubled as a smoking area. Wifi in all rooms as well.
reviews.title: Do not stay anywhere else in Takayama!

reviews.text: We didn't opt for meal plan. Thus, can't comment.
reviews.title: Arigato to the Oyado!!

reviews.text: Location is great since it is located near the historical areas as well as the main shopping street. Abundance of restaurants nearby. The bus from the station stops almost right in front of the minshuku. Thus, we took the bus both ways from and back to the station.
reviews.title: A Cozy and Homey stay in Takayama

reviews.text: Over all, it was a pleasure staying here and I would return if I am ever in Takayama again.
reviews.title: Excellent value & warm hospitality
